markdownRemark.html:
快速体验

Create a TypeScript project with create-react-app and introduce and use choerodon-ui

  1. Create a project

    yarn create-react-app c7n-demo-ts --template typescript or npx create-react-app c7n-demo-ts --template typescript

  2. Check that the creation was successful

    cd c7n-demo-ts yarn start Access the http://localhost:3000/ through a browser to check whether it was created successfully

  3. Add choerodon-ui in project

    Add choerodon-ui and dependent dependencies

Friendly support

  1. Component libraries are built almost entirely using typescript and provide good support for the typescript language
  2. In order for the component to be used correctly and appropriately, we have carried out strict and standardized type definitions, combined with static type checking in TypeScript, so that some problems can be found in advance and solved in time during the development phase
    enum FieldType {
        auto = "auto",
        boolean = "boolean",
        number = "number",
        currency = "currency",
        string = "string",
        date = "date",
        dateTime = "dateTime",
        week = "week",
        month = "month",
        year = "year",
        time = "time",
        object = "object",
        intl = "intl",
        email = "email",
        url = "url",
        color = "color",
        reactNode = "reactNode"
    }
  1. We have extracted the public types of the component, and for some logically complex types, we can directly find the corresponding interface file for the required type export, reducing code redundancy and making development more convenient
// interface.tsx

export {
    ButtonProps,
} from './Button';

export {
    ButtonColor,
    FuncType,
    ButtonType,
    ButtonTooltip,
} from './enum';

Introduced at the time of use

import { ButtonColor,ButtonProps } from 'choerodon-ui/pro/lib/button/interface';
  1. For fixed enumeration types, VSCode will intelligently prompt, which can be quickly developed and reduce the occurrence of low-level problems such as spelling errors

  1. Detailed annotations are made during component development, making it easy to view the interface types and properties of some components for rapid development

  1. VSCode provides plug-in support, which greatly improves the development experience and efficiency

  • Completes the special syntax in DataSet

  • Quickly create components that complete required properties when they are created to reduce usage errors

  • Convenient API viewing method, including floating prompts and built-in documents

Demo

Here is the reference to the LabelAlign type in the form

    import React, { FC } from 'react';
    import { Form, TextField, TextArea, Switch } from 'choerodon-ui/pro';
    import { LabelAlign } from 'choerodon-ui/pro/lib/form/interface';
    import Record from 'choerodon-ui/pro/lib/data-set/Record';

    const EditDetail: FC<{
    record: Record;
    readOnly?: boolean;
    isNew?: boolean;
    }> = (props) => {
    const { record, readOnly = false, isNew = false } = props;
    return (
        <div>
        <Form labelAlign={LabelAlign.left} disabled={readOnly} record={record}>
            {!isNew && <TextField name="serialNumber" disabled />}
            <TextField name="title" />
            <TextArea name="description" />
            <TextField name="remark" />
            <Switch name="status" />
        </Form>
        </div>
    );
    };

    export default EditDetail;

Other options

If you have followed create-react-app Used in The environment is initialized, you can refer to the official document Adding TypeScript Configure the TypeScript development environment.

Create React apps (with Typescript and antd) with no build configuration

react-app-rewire-typescript

ts-import-plugin

Migrating from create-react-app-typescript to Create React App
